Reprieve.origin: [alteration of earlier repry to send back (to prison), return to custody, perhaps from Anglo-French repris , past participle of reprendre to take back, from Old French]

re·priev·ing.definition: [alteration of earlierto send back (to prison), return to custody, perhaps from Anglo-French, past participle ofto take back, from Old French]to delay the punishment of (as a condemned prisoner)n

1 a.definition: the act of reprievingthe state of being reprieved

sub_terms.b: a formal temporary suspension of the execution of a sentence esp. of death as an act of clemency

2.definition: an order or warrant of reprieve
